meanings.definition: The act of abolishing something, such as a law or practice.
meanings.sent1: The abolishments of outdated rules brought relief to many.
meanings.sent2: The abolishments of unjust regulations improved society.
meanings.sent3: The abolishments of silly laws made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her abolishments of unnecessary restrictions were like breaking free from chains.
meanings.sent5: The abolishments of oppressive policies were long overdue.

meanings.definition: The state of being abolished or annulled.
meanings.sent1: The abolishments of the old traditions signaled a new era.
meanings.sent2: The abolishments of the outdated system led to progress.
meanings.sent3: The abolishments of the ancient rules seemed like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent4: His abolishments of the past were like tearing down walls.
meanings.sent5: The abolishments of the unjust regime were celebrated by all.
